intro: Paepalanthus sedoides, commonly known as the yellow puya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, spiky inflorescence that bears numerous yellow flowers. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, dry conditions. It has strap-like leaves that form a rosette, helping to collect and retain moisture. Due to its striking appearance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
